data.fullContent: The modern architecture of Western culture began in the late 1800s as a reaction against the ornate styles of the 19th century. It valued practical construction over artistic or decorative design. Its designs were simple and functional and showed no unnecessary ornamentation or decoration. Modern architects designed buildings using basic geometric shapes and heavy materials such as concrete and steel. The modern architecture of the West is also known as the International Style because of the many countries whose architects contributed to it. Modern architects were united in their rejection of the past. They wanted to present a new face for architecture that emphasized functionalism and economy of design. Led by such modern masters as Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, Le Corbusier, Walter Gropius, and Alvar Aalto, this style dominated the world of architecture until the late 1950s.

q1.translation: 西方文化的现代建筑始于19世纪末，是对19世纪华丽风格的一种反抗。它重视实用的建筑而非艺术或装饰的设计。它的设计简单实用，没有不必要的装饰或装饰。现代建筑师使用基本的几何形状和沉重的材料，如混凝土和钢铁来设计建筑。西方的现代建筑也被称为国际风格，因为许多国家的建筑师对其作出了贡献。现代建筑师们一致拒绝过去。
q1.front: The modern architecture of Western culture began in the late 1800s as a reaction against the ornate styles of the 19th century. It valued practical construction over artistic or decorative design. Its designs were simple and functional and showed no unnecessary ornamentation or decoration. Modern architects designed buildings using basic geometric shapes and heavy materials such as concrete and steel. The modern architecture of the West is also known as the International Style because of the many countries whose architects contributed to it. Modern architects were united in their rejection of the past.
q1.content: The modern architecture of Western culture began in the ____ 1800s as a reaction against the ornate styles of the 19th ____. It valued practical construction over artistic or decorative design. Its designs were ____ and functional and showed no unnecessary ornamentation or decoration. Modern architects ____ buildings using basic geometric shapes and heavy ____ such as concrete and steel. The modern ____ of the West is also ____ as the International Style because of the ____ countries whose architects contributed to ____. Modern architects were united in their rejection of the past.

q2.translation: 西方文化的现代建筑始于19世纪末，是对19世纪华丽风格的一种反抗。它重视实用的建筑而非艺术或装饰的设计。它的设计简单实用，没有不必要的装饰或装饰。现代建筑师使用基本的几何形状和沉重的材料，如混凝土和钢铁来设计建筑。西方的现代建筑也被称为国际风格，因为许多国家的建筑师对其作出了贡献。现代建筑师们一致拒绝过去。他们希望为建筑呈现出一种新的面貌，强调功能主义和设计的经济性。在路德维希·密斯·凡德罗、勒·柯布西耶、沃尔特·格罗皮乌斯和阿尔瓦·阿尔托等现代大师的领导下，这种风格一直主导着建筑界，直到20世纪50年代末。
q2.front: The modern architecture of Western culture began in the late 1800s as a reaction against the ornate styles of the 19th century. It valued practical construction over artistic or decorative design. Its designs were simple and functional and showed no unnecessary ornamentation or decoration. Modern architects designed buildings using basic geometric shapes and heavy materials such as concrete and steel. The modern architecture of the West is also known as the International Style because of the many countries whose architects contributed to it. Modern architects were united in their rejection of the past.
q2.middle: They wanted to present a new face for architecture that emphasized functionalism and economy of design.
q2.ending: Led by such modern masters as Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, Le Corbusier, Walter Gropius, and Alvar Aalto, this style dominated the world of architecture until the late 1950s.

options.sentence: They also use concrete and steel as structural elements, and utilize pattern and color to create spatial illusions.
They wanted to present a new face for architecture that emphasized functionalism and economy of design.
A study is needed to reveal the deliberate balance of opposites the architect sought to achieve.
The structural design of a building is essential for sound building safety and performance.
